DataElement.preferredName: Estrogen Receptor or Progesterone Receptor Positive per ASCO/CAP Guideline Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Response indicating whether tumor is Estrogen Receptor (ER) and/or Progesterone Receptor (PgR) positive per American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) or College of American Pathologists (CAP) guideline.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Estrogen Receptor Positive Progesterone Receptor Positive American Society of Clinical Oncology Or College of American Pathologists Guideline
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An indication that estrogen receptor alpha expression has been detected in a sample._An indication that progesterone receptor (PRG; PR) expression has been detected in a sample.:The world's leading professional organization representing physicians of all oncology disciplines and subspecialties. ASCO sets the standard for cancer care, supports funding for clinical and translational research, fosters the exchange of information related to cancer, including cancer biology, diagnosis, staging, treatment and psychosocial impact.  ASCO provides training in clinical research and patient care and publishes the Journal of Clinical Oncology._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A member-based physician that serves patients, pathologists, and the public by fostering and advocating best practices in pathology and laboratory medicine._A systematic statement of policy rules or principles. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by convening expert panels.

Property.preferredName: American Society of Clinical Oncology Or College of American Pathologists Guideline
Property.preferredDefinition: The world's leading professional organization representing physicians of all oncology disciplines and subspecialties. ASCO sets the standard for cancer care, supports funding for clinical and translational research, fosters the exchange of information related to cancer, including cancer biology, diagnosis, staging, treatment and psychosocial impact.  ASCO provides training in clinical research and patient care and publishes the Journal of Clinical Oncology._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A member-based physician that serves patients, pathologists, and the public by fostering and advocating best practices in pathology and laboratory medicine._A systematic statement of policy rules or principles. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by convening expert panels.

Concepts.definition: The world's leading professional organization representing physicians of all oncology disciplines and subspecialties. ASCO sets the standard for cancer care, supports funding for clinical and translational research, fosters the exchange of information related to cancer, including cancer biology, diagnosis, staging, treatment and psychosocial impact.  ASCO provides training in clinical research and patient care and publishes the Journal of Clinical Oncology.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A member-based physician that serves patients, pathologists, and the public by fostering and advocating best practices in pathology and laboratory medicine.

A systematic statement of policy rules or principles. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by convening expert panels.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the tumor determined to be ER and/or PgR positive assessed by current ASCO/CAP Guideline Recommendations for hormone receptor testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
